question.stem: Many houses located near beaches look like the house shown in the drawing. {img:images/States2017/AR/AR_7thGr_2010_1.png} What does this type of house indicate about the area?

choices.text: The soil is unstable in the area.
choices.label: C

choices.text: The soil stays frozen in the area.
choices.label: D

question.stem: This diagram shows a portion of a roller coaster ride. {img:images/States2017/AR/AR_7thGr_2013_1.png} If energy losses due to friction can be ignored, which of the following statements is correct?

choices.text: At Position Z, kinetic energy is greater than at Position X.
choices.label: A

choices.text: At Position Y, potential energy is greater than at Position W.
choices.label: B

choices.text: At Position X, potential energy is lowest and kinetic energy is greatest.
choices.label: C

choices.text: At Position W, potential energy is lowest and kinetic energy is greatest.
choices.label: D

question.stem: Students conducted an experiment to test how temperature changes can affect a rubber ball. They repeatedly dropped the rubber ball from the same location and recorded the height of each initial bounce. {img:images/States2017/AK/AK_8thGr_2016_5.png} Which statement best explains why the students conducted three trials?

choices.text: Three trials were used because the students studied three different temperatures.
choices.label: A

choices.text: The students repeated the experiment until the ball reached a height of 48 cm.
choices.label: B

choices.text: The students used the first trial to practice and the last two trials to collect experimental data.
choices.label: C

choices.text: Performing an experiment with multiple trials can increase the accuracy of the students' results.
choices.label: D

question.stem: The following table shows properties of four different sample materials. One of these materials is cork, a type of wood that floats in water. {img:images/States2017/CA/CA_8thGr_2008_6.png} Given that the density of water is 1 g/mL, which mL of the samples is most likely cork?
Use the food web below to answer the question. {img:images/States2017/LA/LA_no_year_8thGr_5.png} Which of these are not represented in the food web?

Use the information and table below to answer the question. Curtis conducted an experiment to see if some liquids mix with Liquid X. His results are shown in the table. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2000_8.png} Based on this data, which is the best conclusion?

choices.text: Liquid X cannot mix with any other liquid.
choices.label: A

choices.text: Liquid X must be able to mix with some other liquid.
choices.label: B

choices.text: Liquid X cannot mix with these four liquids.
choices.label: C

choices.text: Liquid X can mix with most other liquids.
choices.label: D

question.stem: Use the diagram below to answer the question. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2001_10.png} Everything that enters this cell passes through which structure?
Use the diagram below to answer the question. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2001_2.png} All of the internal structures shown in the diagram together make up what level of organization?
Which of the following diagrams represents a solar eclipse?
A carefully measured amount of soil is placed in an oven and heated to burn off the organic material. Which of the following tools is best used to measure the mass of the remaining soil?
The graph below relates distance and time for a moving object. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2004_4.png} What is the speed of the object represented by the graph above?
The following illustration shows a design shape. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2004_22.png} Which of the following is an accurate orthographic projection of the design shown above?

The diagram below shows a circuit. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_9thGr_technology_2004_7.png} Which of the following diagrams shows a voltmeter correctly attached to measure the voltage drop in R2?

The diagram below shows a pair of pliers gripping a bolt. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_9thGr_technology_2004_16.png} Pliers multiply the force of a person's grip through the use of leverage. For the pliers shown, A = 10 lbs., a = 3 in., and b = 1 in. What is the gripping force, B, at the jaws of the pliers?

The diagram below shows two aluminum spheres. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_9thGr_physics_2004_4.png} Aluminum sphere A contains a small negative charge and is touched by aluminum sphere B, which has a larger negative charge. Which of the following occurs next?

choices.text: Protons flow from sphere B to sphere A.
choices.label: A

choices.text: Protons flow from sphere A to sphere B.
choices.label: B

choices.text: Electrons flow from sphere B to sphere A.
choices.label: C

choices.text: Electrons flow from sphere A to sphere B.
choices.label: D

question.stem: The diagram below represents part of the horse fossil record from three time periods. It includes illustrations of the hooves and teeth of Horse's from each time period. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2005_2.png} Which of the following statements is best supported by the horse fossil record?

choices.text: The horse has been a carnivore.
choices.label: A

choices.text: The horse has changed over time.
choices.label: B

choices.text: The horse has many common ancestors.
choices.label: C

choices.text: The horse has lived in the same ecosystem.
choices.label: D

question.stem: A hot air balloon exerts a force of 1200 N while lifting a load of 800 N. Which free-body force diagram depicts the forces involved?
The picture below shows an iron. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2006_13.png} When considering an iron as an example of a system, what is the input?

The drawing below shows part of a graduated cylinder containing liquid. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2006_1.png} Based on the sensitivity of the graduated cylinder, what is the volume of the liquid?
The following diagram shows a caterpillar, mold, and a fern. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2006_32.png} What do these organisms have in common?
The graph below relates distance to time for a rolling ball. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2006_3.png} What is the average speed of the ball?

The distance vs. time graph below shows data collected as a remote-controlled car moved across a level parking lot. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_9thGr_physics_2006_1.png} According to the graph, which of the following conclusions about the car's motion is supported?

choices.text: The car is stopping and starting.
choices.label: B

choices.text: The car is traveling at a constant velocity.
choices.label: C

choices.text: The car is moving through an obstacle course.
choices.label: D

question.stem: The diagram below illustrates how plant root cells take in mineral ions from the surrounding soil. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_9thGr_2006_15.png} Which of the following processes is illustrated?
A freshwater food web is shown below. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_9thGr_2006_25.png} The X in this food web most likely represents which of the following?

The table below shows the number of each kind of atom that makes up one molecule of the compounds sucrose and ethanol. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2009_2.png} Which of the following is the same for both compounds?

choices.text: the types of atoms in each molecule
choices.label: C

choices.text: the number of atoms in each molecule
choices.label: D

question.stem: The diagram below shows a major system of the human body. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2009_8.png} Which of the following best describes the function of this system?

choices.text: responding to stimuli in the environment
choices.label: D

question.stem: The diagram below shows the path of a ball bouncing on the ground. Four locations in the path are identified with numbers. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2016_1.png} At which location does the ball have the greatest amount of kinetic energy?

The map below shows the locations of two cities. City Y is near the coast, and city Z is near the middle of a continent. The cities have the same elevation. {img:images/States2017/Mass/Mass_8thGr_2016_2.png} Based on the map, which of the following statements describes how the climates of the two cities are most likely different?

choices.text: City Y receives less rain than city Z.
choices.label: A

choices.text: City Y has colder winters than city Z.
choices.label: B

choices.text: City Y has cooler summers than city Z.
choices.label: C

choices.text: City Y receives more sunlight than city Z.
choices.label: D

question.stem: Each circle shown below represents a different atom. {img:images/States2017/ME/ME_8thGr_2010_6.png} Which diagram illustrates that matter is always conserved during a chemical reaction?

The table below shows five elements and the way they react with chlorine (Cl). {img:images/States2017/ME/ME_8thGr_2010_4.png} Which two elements are most likely from the same family or group in the periodic table?
The diagram below shows the water cycle. {img:images/States2017/ME/ME_8thGr_2014-2015_13.png} Which statement best describes the water cycle?

choices.text: Driven by the Sun, the water cycle adds new water as precipitation.
choices.label: A

choices.text: Driven by the Sun, the water cycle moves water throughout Earth.
choices.label: B

choices.text: Driven by Earth's internal heat, the water cycle adds new water as precipitation.
choices.label: C

choices.text: Driven by Earth's internal heat, the water cycle moves water throughout the planet.
choices.label: D

question.stem: The pyramid below shows how energy changes forms and is transferred in a food chain. {img:images/States2017/ME/ME_8thGr_2014-2015_1.png} Which statement explains why less energy is available as it is transferred through each step of the food chain?

choices.text: Heat is added at each level.
choices.label: A

choices.text: Organisms at each level use some of the energy.
choices.label: B

choices.text: The higher levels do not need as much energy.
choices.label: C

choices.text: Organisms at lower levels destroy some of the energy
choices.label: D

question.stem: The diagram below shows an electromagnet. {img:images/States2017/ME/ME_8thGr_2016_2.png} Which statement best describes this application of an electromagnet?

choices.text: The magnetic field in the battery causes an electrical current in the nail.
choices.label: A

choices.text: The magnetic field in the battery causes a magnetic field around the nail.
choices.label: B

choices.text: The electrical current supplied by the battery causes an electrical current in the nail.
choices.label: C

choices.text: The electrical current supplied by the battery causes a magnetic field around the nail.
choices.label: D

question.stem: Unknown Liquid Demonstrations A science teacher played a short video of two demonstrations that used the same unknown clear liquid. Demonstration 1: The teacher in the video placed one drop of the unknown clear liquid onto a piece of pH paper. The pH paper turned red, indicating a pH of 2. {img:images/States2017/MD/MD_8thGr_2012_5.png} Demonstration 2: The teacher in the video placed a beaker containing a copper penny under an operating fume hood, which safely removes gases. With the fume hood running, the teacher placed one drop of the unknown clear liquid on the copper penny. A dark red gas and a blue liquid immediately formed. The chemical property of copper shown in the second demonstration is identified as

There are many snow-capped mountains around the world. {img:images/States2017/MD/MD_8thGr_2012_10.png} The elevation of this mountain is nearly 3,048 meters. The summer climate in the area is generally cool and rainy. Summer temperatures reach 21째C. During many months of the year, the day and night temperatures vary significantly. The weather changes quickly. Approximately 300 centimeters of snow usually covers the ground from November until May. While studying mountain geology, a scientist uncovered many marine fossils. The presence of marine fossils on the mountain supports the conclusion that the mountain area was once

There are many snow-capped mountains around the world. {img:images/States2017/MD/MD_8thGr_2012_10.png} The elevation of this mountain is nearly 3,048 meters. The summer climate in the area is generally cool and rainy. Summer temperatures reach 21째C. During many months of the year, the day and night temperatures vary significantly. The weather changes quickly. Approximately 300 centimeters of snow usually covers the ground from November until May. As the snow on a mountain melts, water travels down the mountain and seeps into the soil and the pores of rocks. Water contained in the soil and the pores of rocks is referred to as

There are many snow-capped mountains around the world. {img:images/States2017/MD/MD_8thGr_2012_10.png} The elevation of this mountain is nearly 3,048 meters. The summer climate in the area is generally cool and rainy. Summer temperatures reach 21째C. During many months of the year, the day and night temperatures vary significantly. The weather changes quickly. Approximately 300 centimeters of snow usually covers the ground from November until May. Water is easily trapped in cracks and layers of mountain rock. Alternating high and low temperatures affect the water, which freezes and thaws many times. Which process causes changes to the rocks due to repeated freezing and thawing of trapped water?
Part of the rock cycle is shown in the diagram below. {img:images/States2017/MD/MD_8thGr_2015_4.png} The change that occurred to the rock between Steps 1 and 2 in this part of the rock cycle was

choices.text: sedimentary rock changed to igneous rock
choices.label: A

choices.text: igneous rock changed to sedimentary rock
choices.label: B

choices.text: metamorphic rock changed to igneous rock
choices.label: C

choices.text: sedimentary rock changed to metamorphic rock
choices.label: D

question.stem: A candle is placed on a ruled grid in front of a mirror, as shown. At what point will the reflection of the candle appear to be? {img:images/States2017/TIMSS/TIMSS_2003_8thGr_18.png}

The graph shows the progress made by a beetle moving along a straight line. {img:images/States2017/TIMSS/TIMSS_2003_8thGr_22.png} If the beetle keeps moving at the same speed, how long will it take to travel 10 cm?
The diagram below shows Earth's water cycle. {img:images/States2017/TIMSS/TIMSS_8thGr_2007_31.png} What is the source of energy for the water cycle?

Mary went for a cycle ride during which she had a puncture. She repaired it straight away and immediately continued her ride. The graph shows the progress she made during the ride. {img:images/States2017/TIMSS/TIMSS_8thGr_2007_32.png} About how long did it take Mary to mend the puncture?

Bob did an experiment to investigate the effect of temperature on the solubility of sugar in water by measuring the amount of sugar that would dissolve in 1 liter of water at different temperatures. He then plotted his results. Which of the following is likely to be the graph showing Bob's results?

Scientists think that the rocks in the picture were once a single rock. {img:images/States2017/TIMSS/TIMSS_8thGR_2011_12.png} Which property of water had the most effect of splitting the rock into two pieces?

choices.text: Water having a density less than rock.
choices.label: C

question.stem: Look at the two groups of organisms in the chart below: {img:images/States2017/WA/WA_8thGr_2004_9.png} The organisms are separated into the two groups based on what characteristic?

Wild About Radishes Amanda wanted to find out how acidic water affects plant growth. Amanda decided to do an investigation using radish plants and several water samples with different acidities as measured by pH. Question: How does the acidity of water affect the height of radish plants? Hypothesis (prediction): Radish plants given water with a pH of 7 will grow taller than radish plants given water with a pH lower than 7 because plants will not grow well with water that is acidic. Materials: radish seeds small plant pots filled with soil water samples each with a different acidity: pH 4, pH 5, pH 6, and pH 7 graduated cylinders labels ruler {img:images/States2017/WA/WA_8thGr_2007_1.png} Procedure: 1. Label six pots pH 4, six pots pH 5, six pots pH 6, and six pots pH 7 as shown in the Investigation Setup diagram. 2. Plant one radish seed in each pot. 3. Every three days pour 5 milliliters of water with the labeled pH into each pot. 4. Measure and record the height of the tallest leaf of each radish plant after watering. 5. After two weeks, calculate and record the average plant height for each of the four pH groups. Data: The table below shows the calculated average plant heights for the six plants in each of the groups. {img:images/States2017/WA/WA_8thGr_2007_2.png} Which of the following variables was a controlled (kept the same) variable in this investigation?

Wild About Radishes Amanda wanted to find out how acidic water affects plant growth. Amanda decided to do an investigation using radish plants and several water samples with different acidities as measured by pH. Question: How does the acidity of water affect the height of radish plants? Hypothesis (prediction): Radish plants given water with a pH of 7 will grow taller than radish plants given water with a pH lower than 7 because plants will not grow well with water that is acidic. Materials: radish seeds small plant pots filled with soil water samples each with a different acidity: pH 4, pH 5, pH 6, and pH 7 graduated cylinders labels ruler {img:images/States2017/WA/WA_8thGr_2007_1.png} Procedure: 1. Label six pots pH 4, six pots pH 5, six pots pH 6, and six pots pH 7 as shown in the Investigation Setup diagram. 2. Plant one radish seed in each pot. 3. Every three days pour 5 milliliters of water with the labeled pH into each pot. 4. Measure and record the height of the tallest leaf of each radish plant after watering. 5. After two weeks, calculate and record the average plant height for each of the four pH groups. Data: The table below shows the calculated average plant heights for the six plants in each of the groups. {img:images/States2017/WA/WA_8thGr_2007_2.png} How could Amanda make the investigation results more reliable?

choices.text: Change the amount of soil in each pot
choices.label: C

choices.text: Increase the amount of water added each week
choices.label: D

A species of bird migrates from South America across the Atlantic Ocean to its summer breeding ground in northern Canada. The birds stop on the east coast of the United States to eat the eggs of horseshoe crabs. The migration route of these birds is shown on the map below. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/MCAS/8thGr/MCAS_8_2015_2.png} Which of the following changes would most threaten this species of bird with extinction?

choices.text: increased sizes of horseshoe crab eggs
choices.label: C

question.stem: Use the information below to answer the question. During an investigation, students were given chemical data for several common household products, as shown in the data table below. Students were to determine if a substance was an acid or base by using litmus paper. Litmus paper turns red in an acid and turns blue in a base. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MD/MSA_8_2007_25.png} Which physical property best classifies vinegar in a separate group of substances from oven cleaner?

Students were to determine if a substance was an acid or base by using litmus paper. Litmus paper turns red in an acid and turns blue in a base. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MD/MSA_8_2007_25.png} Which statement describes the motion of the molecules within the carpet cleaner when enough heat energy is added to boil the carpet cleaner?

choices.text: The molecules begin moving at a constant rate.

question.stem: Hikers often use a compass and a map to determine their location. The needle on a compass moves and aligns with the magnetic field of Earth because the needle is magnetized. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MD/MSA_8_2008_17.png} Which action most likely affects the accuracy of a compass?

choices.text: moving close to overhead power lines
choices.label: D

question.stem: Use the information below to answer the question. In a lab study, eight bean plants are grown from seeds in individual containers. After a few leaves are visible on each plant, the plants are separated into two groups. One group is placed in a room that gets sunlight, and the other group is placed in a dark room. All of the plants receive the same amount of water daily. After two weeks, the plants are observed. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MD/MSA_8_2009_5.png} Plants use energy from the sun to convert

choices.text: carbon dioxide and water to sugars
choices.label: C

choices.text: sugars to water and carbon dioxide
choices.label: D

question.stem: Use the information below to answer the question. In a lab study, eight bean plants are grown from seeds in individual containers. Some students hypothesized that warmer water caused the change in gill slit movement. Other students hypothesized that dirtier water caused the change in gill slit movement. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MD/MSA_8_2011_6.png} Both hypotheses are valuable because they

Gravity pulled three toy cars of different masses down an inclined ramp. The toy cars hit a bumper at the bottom of the ramp. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MD/MSA_8_2013_1.png} What is the ratio of the masses of the toy cars?

Use the information below to answer the question. Zebra Mussels Zebra mussels have been found in the Chesapeake Bay. These small, nonnative mussels sometimes cause economic, environmental, and ecological problems. They block the water intake pipes of industrial plants and limit the ability of the plants to generate power, provide drinking water, or treat sewage. The mussel populations grow rapidly and spread to other bodies of water by attaching to boats and equipment below the surface of the water. They consume large amounts of the algae in the water and may decrease the oxygen level of the water. Many beaches are also littered with the sharp shells of decaying zebra mussels. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MD/MSA_8_2013_11.png} Zebra mussels most likely compete with other organisms for

Use the information below to answer the question. Zebra Mussels Zebra mussels have been found in the Chesapeake Bay. These small, nonnative mussels sometimes cause economic, environmental, and ecological problems. They block the water intake pipes of industrial plants and limit the ability of the plants to generate power, provide drinking water, or treat sewage. The mussel populations grow rapidly and spread to other bodies of water by attaching to boats and equipment below the surface of the water. They consume large amounts of the algae in the water and may decrease the oxygen level of the water. Many beaches are also littered with the sharp shells of decaying zebra mussels. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MD/MSA_8_2013_11.png} An increase in a population of zebra mussels would best be supported by a body of water which has

question.stem: Use the information below to answer the question. Casey has two glass jars of the same size. He fills one with water; the other contains air. He places a flat magnet on the top of each lid and a metal ball bearing on the inside of each lid under the magnet. He then screws each lid onto a jar. The magnets hold the ball bearings in place under the lids. Casey then removes the magnets at the same time, and the ball bearings drop into the jars. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MEAP/MEAP_8_2005_12.png} Suppose Casey adds a third glass jar containing syrup to the experiment. The picture below shows his new experimental design. He follows the same procedure, removing the magnets from all three jars at the same time. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/MEAP/MEAP_8_2005_13.png} Will Casey be able to draw a valid conclusion from the new data?

choices.text: Yes, because the jars are all made of the same material.
choices.label: A

choices.text: No, the syrup jar is shorter and it will invalidate the results.
choices.label: B

choices.text: Yes, the same procedure is followed and results will be valid.
choices.label: C

choices.text: No, syrup is a colored liquid and it will invalidate the results.
choices.label: D

question.stem: Consider this food web: {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/NC/NC_8_2013_1.png} Where is the largest amount of energy found in this food web?

Ancient Trees The climate in central California's White Mountains is cold and dry. Clouds traveling east tend to lose their moisture over the Sierra Nevada, a large mountain range just west of the White Mountains. For this reason, the White Mountains receive less than 30 cm of precipitation per year. Most of this precipitation falls as snow. The White Mountains are the home of the oldest living trees on Earth, bristlecone pines that can survive thousands of years. Bristlecone pines have several strategies for surviving in this dry environment. These trees often grow in patches of dolomite soil. Dolomite is a type of limestone that holds more moisture than the surrounding sandstone. The light color of the dolomite soil reflects sunlight, helping keep the trees' roots cool and conserving the limited moisture. Needles on these trees can live 20 to 30 years. They provide a stable source of photosynthesis for many years. These ancient trees teach scientists about Earth's climate history. Each spring and summer the trees grow a layer of new cells between the living wood and the bark. The trees grow more in a wet year than in a dry year. Because these trees live a long time, they can be used as a record of climate change over thousands of years. {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/TAKS/TAKS_8_2009_9.png} The dolomite soil keeps the roots of the bristlecone pines cool by -

choices.text: absorbing chemical energy from the roots
choices.label: A

choices.text: transforming heat energy into chemical energy
choices.label: B

choices.text: transferring thermal energy from the soil to the roots
choices.label: C

choices.text: reflecting the heat energy from the soil around the roots
choices.label: D

choices.text: Jumping spiders are faster than yellow garden spiders.

question.stem: Hot Lamp Brandi and Jerry did the following controlled experiment to find out how the color of an object affects its temperature. Question: What is the effect of different lid colors on the air temperature inside a glass jar exposed to a lamp? Hypothesis: The darker the lid color, the greater the increase in air temperature in the glass jar, because darker colors absorb more energy. Materials: glass jar lamp four colored lids: black, dark gray, light gray, and white thermometer meterstick stopwatch {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/WA-MSP/WA-MSP_8_2012_1.png} Procedure: 1. Put the black lid with the attached thermometer on the glass jar. 2. Make sure the starting temperature inside the jar is 24째 C. 3. Place lamp 5 centimeters away from the lid and turn on the lamp. 4. After 10 minutes measure the air temperature inside the glass jar and record as Trial 1. 5. Turn off lamp and wait until the air in the jar returns to the starting temperature. 6. Repeat steps 2 through 5 for Trials 2 and 3. 7. Repeat steps 1 through 6 for the dark gray, light gray, and white lids. 8. Calculate and record the average air temperature for each lid color. Data: {img:images/StatesDMC-DA/8thGr/WA-MSP/WA-MSP_8_2012_2.png} What was the purpose of waiting until the air in the jar returned to the starting temperature in Brandi and Jerry's experiment?

choices.text: To have the same time between trials
choices.label: A

choices.text: To keep a variable the same for every trial
choices.label: B

choices.text: To allow the lamp to cool down after every trial
choices.label: C

choices.text: To provide time to change the lid color between trials
choices.label: D
